poststar.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of The Post-Star, a daily newspaper that covers the Lake George region of upstate New York, including Glens Falls and Saratoga Springs.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Post-Star is owned by Lee Enterprises, a publicly traded, Iowa-based media company that owns more than 40 daily newspapers and almost 300 specialty publications across the United States. Poststar.com derives revenue from advertisements, sponsored links, sponsored content, and a paywall.

Content

The Post-Star covers news, sports, weather, and entertainment in New York’s Lake George region. The site also offers national and international news, provided by wire services including The Associated Press. On a typical day, the site reported on a man charged with kidnapping a local 12-year girl; Washington County officials hurriedly complying with a new law meant to cut the time between the arrest and arraignment of teenagers; and a breakdown of costs for a new visitor center in the area.

Credibility

Articles are balanced and fact-based, and typically quote multiple credible sources. Headlines accurately describe the content of articles.

Poststar.com publishes an ethics policy, which includes a corrections policy. The site regularly posts corrections to its articles and makes it clear how to report errors. Opinion is separated from news.

In 2009, the Pulitzer Prize in Editorial Writing was awarded to The Post-Star editorial page for editorials on the pitfalls of local government secrecy.

Transparency

The site posts names and contact information of its management and reporters. Articles written by many Post-Star staff include the author’s name and contact information, but some articles in the Lifestyles section do not carry the author’s name. Adam Colver, online editor and webmaster of the Post-Star, told NewsGuard via email that the unattributed stories come from the Lee Enterprises digital team.

The site clearly labels advertising and sponsored content. Its ownership by Lee Enterprises is disclosed.

History

The Post-Star began publishing in 1895.
